Vespiquen.flavor: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.

Pachirisu.flavor: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

Buizel.flavor: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

Floatzel.flavor: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

Cherubi.flavor: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.

Cherrim.flavor: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.

Shellos.flavor: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

Gastrodon.flavor: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.

Ambipom.flavor: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.

Drifloon.flavor: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

Drifblim.flavor: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.

Buneary.flavor: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.

Lopunny.flavor: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

Mismagius.flavor: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.

Honchkrow.flavor: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”

Glameow.flavor: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

Purugly.flavor: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

Chingling.flavor: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.

Stunky.flavor: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

Skuntank.flavor: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

Bronzor.flavor: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor’s back contained a mysterious power.

Bronzong.flavor: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

Bonsly.flavor: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels.

Mime Jr..flavor: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy’s movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

Happiny.flavor: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.

Chatot.flavor: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.

Spiritomb.flavor: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

Gible.flavor: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

Gabite.flavor: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

Garchomp.flavor: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

Munchlax.flavor: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.

Riolu.flavor: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.

Lucario.flavor: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.

Hippopotas.flavor: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.

Hippowdon.flavor: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.

Skorupi.flavor: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

Drapion.flavor: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.

Croagunk.flavor: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

Toxicroak.flavor: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

Carnivine.flavor: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

Finneon.flavor: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.

Lumineon.flavor: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.

Mantyke.flavor: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.

Snover.flavor: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

Abomasnow.flavor: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”

Weavile.flavor: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

Magnezone.flavor: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

Lickilicky.flavor: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

Rhyperior.flavor: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

Tangrowth.flavor: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

Electivire.flavor: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

Magmortar.flavor: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

Togekiss.flavor: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.

Yanmega.flavor: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

Leafeon.flavor: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.

Glaceon.flavor: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.

Gliscor.flavor: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

Mamoswine.flavor: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

Porygon-z.flavor: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.

Gallade.flavor: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

Probopass.flavor: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.

Dusknoir.flavor: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

Froslass.flavor: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.

Rotom.flavor: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

Uxie.flavor: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

Mesprit.flavor: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

Azelf.flavor: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

Dialga.flavor: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

Palkia.flavor: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

Heatran.flavor: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

Regigigas.flavor: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

Giratina Origin Forme.flavor: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

Cresselia.flavor: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

Phione.flavor: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

Manaphy.flavor: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

Darkrai.flavor: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

Shaymin Land.flavor: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

Arceus (Normal).flavor: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
